intro: Ginoria syphilitica, commonly known as the syphilitic ginoria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its upright, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a distinctive serrated edge. Ginoria syphilitica thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
